Package io.elegie.luchess.core.domain.moves

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractFigurineDirectionalMove
    This class represents a directional move: the piece is expected to move along one or many squares, in the same direction (horizontal, vertical or diagonal).
    AbstractFigurineMove
    A figurine move is a move made by a figurine.
    AbstractMove
    All moves share common components: They may all have a starting vertex, called disambiguation.
    AbstractPawnMove
    Provides common behaviors for pawn moves (promotion and value).
    BishopMove
    A bishop moves along diagonals.
    CastleMove
    A castle is special move, by which the king and one of its related rook are moved at the same time.
    KingMove
    A king can move in any direction, but only by one square.
    KnightMove
    A knight moves two moves in a given direction, then one move in a direction perpendicular to the initial direction.
    PawnCaptureMove
    A pawn can only capture pieces in forward diagonals.
    PawnForwardMove
    A pawn can only move forward, by one square, except when it moves from its start position, in which case it may move forward by two squares.
    QueenMove
    A queen moves in any direction (like a combination of a rook and a bishop).
    RookMove
    A rook moves horizontally or vertically.
